text: Vengeance (2003) was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) show made by World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) for their SmackDown! brand. It took place on July 27, 2003 at the Pepsi Center in Denver, Colorado. It was the third Vengeance event held by WWE. ==Results== No. Results Stipulations Times 1 Último Dragón defeated Chris Kanyon Singles match 4:04 2 Eddie Guerrero defeated Chris Benoit Singles match for the vacant WWE United States Championship. 22:12 3 Jamie Noble (with Nidia) defeated Billy Gunn (with Torrie Wilson) Singles match 4:59 4 Bradshaw defeated Shannon Moore, Doink the Clown, Faarooq, Brother Love, Nunzio, Matt Hardy, Chris Kanyon, Danny Basham, Doug Basham, The Easter Bunny, Sean O'Haire, John Hennigan, Orlando Jordan, Funaki, Los Conquistadores (Uno and Dos), The Brooklyn Brawler, Johnny Stamboli, Chuck Palumbo, Matt Cappotelli, and Spanky APA Invitational Bar Room Brawl 4:31 5 The World's Greatest Tag Team (Shelton Benjamin and Charlie Haas) (c) defeated Rey Mysterio and Billy Kidman Tag team match for the WWE Tag Team Championship 14:53 6 Sable defeated Stephanie McMahon No Count-Out match 6:25 7 The Undertaker defeated John Cena Singles match 15:58 8 Mr. McMahon (with Sable) defeated Zach Gowen Singles match 14:03 9 Kurt Angle defeated Brock Lesnar (c) and Big Show No Disqualification Triple Threat match for the WWE Championship 17:30 ==References== ==Other websites== *Official 2003 Vengeance site Category:2003 in professional wrestling Category:Sports in Denver Category:WWE Vengeance Category:21st century in Colorado Category:2003 in the United States Category:July events Category:2003 events
title: Vengeance (2003)
